blocks

Class BentWire

  • java.lang.Object
    • dangerzone.blocks.Block
      • blocks.Wire
        • blocks.BentWire
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PoweredComponent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BentWireActive

    public class BentWire
extends Wire
    Bent wire blocks are one of four kinds of wires, which transmit signals without affecting or being affected by them. Like other wire blocks, bent wire blocks are placed by using a wire item on a flat surface, and are positioned according to wire positioning rules. They are attached to a surface, and will drop if the block they are attached to is not solid during a block update.

    A bent wire's active area is determined by its orientation. At each end of a bent wire, there is a T-shaped active area centered on the outside face. The two active areas face outwards, and do not overlap.

    When powered, bent wire blocks glow just like other kinds of wires.

    Author:
    eaglgenes101
    See Also:
    Wire, BentWireActive

    • Method Detail

      • canConnect

        public boolean canConnect(int dx,
                          int dy,
                          int dz,
                          int meta)
        Description copied from interface: PoweredComponent
        Determines whether this block can send a signal to a block with the given displacement. This method is used to establish connections between active powered components. It can be assumed that dx, dy, and dz are all between -1 and 1, bit it's a good idea to check nevertheless.
        Specified by:
        canConnect in interface PoweredComponent
        Overrides:
        canConnect in class Wire
        Parameters:
        dx - The x-displacement of the target to this block
        dy - The y-displacement of the target to this block
        dz - The z-displacement of the target to this block
        meta - The metadata of this block
        Returns:
        Whether this block can send power to the given block
